info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 30 at 2:16PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS WITH PERIODS OF RAIN AND SNOW THURSDAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT... A winter storm will bring gusty winds, rain, and snow to west central Nevada leading to travel difficulties Thursday and Thursday night. * SNOW: Generally 2 inch or less on valley floors. For higher elevations above 5000 feet, 2-5 inches are likely. The best chances for snow accumulations will be near and after sunset Thursday, with slick and icy road conditions likely Thursday night into early Friday morning as temperatures drop below freezing. * WIND: Strong gusty winds are also expected Thursday, please see Wind Advisories for additional details. For the latest on road conditions, please check with NDOT at nvroads.com or call 5 1 1.
